channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [TIKA-1960] Put legacy language detection code back into 1.x=trunk
item.description:
grossws recently observed on the devlist that we had some recent API breaking changes to the language detection component in 1.x=trunk.

We need to add the legacy code back before the 1.13 release.
item.summary: Put legacy language detection code back into 1.x=trunk

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I think all is back in place. grossws, thank you, again for catching this! Please let me know if we can improve the deprecation messages or if I've botched something.

UNSTABLE: Integrated in tika-trunk-jdk1.7 #972 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/tika-trunk-jdk1.7/972/)
TIKA-1960 – put legacy language detection code back in so that we don't (tallison: rev 64b7ded37f981e298fcb62a996cbaf4ccabb2a96)

SUCCESS: Integrated in tika-trunk-jdk1.7 #973 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/tika-trunk-jdk1.7/973/)
TIKA-1960: Added Welsh Corpus back into test resources to support (dmeikle: rev 19ed2619444af53d1108e1e1243ef8746a165455)

  • tika-core/src/test/resources/org/apache/tika/language/langbuilder/welsh_corpus.txt
Thanks, tallison@apache.org for handling this. Sorry, I hadn't get to laptop yesterday evening to fix it by myself as planned to do.
